Key Match Events: England were bowled out for 103 in 19.4 overs
Brandon King hit an unbeaten 52 as West Indies eased to victory with 17 deliveries to spare
Pre-Game Insights: Eoin Morgan insisted that he would have chosen to bat first as they aim to work on setting a total ahead of another T20 World Cup at the end of the year
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Eoin Morgan: 'West Indies dominated the game early on. We lost early wickets, we didn't seem to adapt well enough in running, which is what you have to do when challenged like that with movement and a bit of bounce.'

West Indies captain Kieron Pollard: 'That's the blueprint we ask guys to put up. Really happy for the guys. To come out and win a match isn't easy, to see the young guys come out and finish it off was fantastic.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The one positive for England is that they have less than 24 hours to wait before trying to put things right, with the second T20 taking place at the same venue on Sunday.
Others: The early damage had been done by the seamers but Akeal Hosein showed there was plenty in the pitch for the spinners too, ripping the ball past Sam Billings (2), who was stumped by a mile to end the seventh over.
